channel.title: DevFreeCasts
channel.description: A huge collection of free screencasts for developers

item.title: Video: Buffers, how to handling binary data or octect streams
item.description: Learning how to work with buffers and handling binary data with node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Buiding a TCP chat server
item.description: Learning how to building a TCP chat serve with node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Closing files and understanding process
item.description: How to work with process and spawing child process in node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Files
item.description: How to work with files in node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Streams one more time and how to create a http server of static files
item.description: How to create a http server of static files and one more little about streams in node
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Timers and blocking envent-loop
item.description: Learning how to blocking the event loop of node.js and understanding timer functions
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Understanding Node.js's streams interface
item.description: That is an advanced concept of streams interface and how to work with it in node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Modules and request http serve
item.description: Learning how to work with modules and building a http server request.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Understanding first class object and closures
item.description: Learning how to work with closures and understanding first-class-object in node.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to event emitter pattern of node.js
item.description: Learning how to work with events in node. It's a basic introduction to event emitter pattern. It is essencial to work with node. This is the first class of free nodejs's course.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Understanding Node.js's streams interface
item.description: That is an advanced concept of streams interface and how to work with it in node.js
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Node.js / io.js Stream Primer
item.description: Get primed on Node.js / io.js Readable, Writable, and Transform Streams
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Custom Data Attributes
item.description: The 17th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you the how to use custom data attributes to add data to HTML elements.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: How to Play Audio with HTML5
item.description: The 16th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you the basics of HTML5 Audio, and you get to hear me sing.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Video Part 4
item.description: The 15th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to get video working on all browsers with a flash fallback.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Video Part 3
item.description: The 14th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you the video attributes in HTML5.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Video Part 2
item.description: The 13th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I talk about how to support the most modern browsers at once with the correct video formats.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Video Part 1
item.description: The 12th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you the basics of getting video up and running on your website. This is a barebones usage of HTML5 Video.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Form Attributes
item.description: The 11th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you the new form attributes in HTML5.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Form Input Types - Part 2
item.description: The 10th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you even more form input types.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Form Input Types
item.description: The 9th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you some of the new form input types!
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Figure and Figcaption
item.description: The 8th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to use figure and figcaption to have essential content with captions.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The Time Element
item.description: The 7th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to use the time element.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Page Structure - Coding a blog
item.description: The 6th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to build the semantic structure of a blog.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: HTML5 Boilerplate
item.description: The 5th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to use HTML5 Boilerplate to start your new projects.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: HTML5 Shiv
item.description: The 4th video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to use the HTML5 Shiv to make sure you code is compatible with older browsers.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Site Structure - Header, Section, Aside, and Footer
item.description: The 3rd video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to use the new Header, Section, Aside and Footer elements to more semantically structure your site.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Starting your first HTML5 site
item.description: The 2nd video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. Here, I show you how to convert an HTML4.01 site into HTML5. The conversion is unimportant, what's key here is what tags you need to start your HTML5 site.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is HTML5?
item.description: The 1st video in our HTML5 Tutorial series. This video contains no actual coding, but does give you a view into what we will be covering in this series.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: SVG Inline and CSS Styling
item.description: Learn how you can have SVG code directly in your HTML document. You also learn how to style SVG with CSS.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Customizing Login with Meteor OAuth
item.description: Meteor has packages for multiple OAuth providers including Facebook, Github and several others. Meteor also provides their own OAuth service called Meteor Developer Accounts. In this video you'll integrate with Meteor Developer Accounts and customize the UI.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using SVG
item.description: Learn how you can start using SVG for vector graphics in your projects today!
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Creating Desktop Apps with Electron
item.description: Learn how to start creating cross platform desktop applications using Electron framework.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: TCP Servers - Episode 2
item.description: TCP service as a stream: Splitting the stream, parsing, encoding, error handling.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 1
item.description: The callback pattern, Chaining calls, Avoid callback hell, Generalizing error handling.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 2
item.description: Coordinating Parallel Calls.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 3
item.description: Parallel Asynchronous Iteration, Parallel Asynchronous Mapping.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 4
item.description: Serial Asynchronous Iteration, Serial Asynchronous Mapping, Limited Parallel Mapping.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 5
item.description: async.series: running operations in series and async.waterfall: cascading results of series execution.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 3
item.description: Nodemon: automatically restart your node process when a file changes.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 6
item.description: Using async.parallel; Coordinating results between async.parallel and async.waterfall.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 7
item.description: Asynchronous Iteration using async; iterating in parallel using async.each; Mapping in parallel using async.map; Iterating in series using async.eachSeries and async.mapSeries; Limiting the maximum amount of parallel requests.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 8
item.description: Using async.queue for building a local work queue.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: HTTP API Servers - Episode 1
item.description: Boostrap a Restify Server. Add Routes. Resources. Logging.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: HTTP API Servers - Episode 2
item.description: Restify Middleware. Route-specific middleware. Using Joi for validation. Validating middleware.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 1
item.description: Installing and using different versions of Node.js and IO.js in your development environment using NVM.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: TCP Servers - Episode 1
item.description: Creating a TCP server; listening for connections; events emitted by connections; reading data; transforming data; using a transform stream to implement a service.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 2
item.description: Shutting down an HTTP Server in an orderly way.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Distributed Large Scale Systems in Go
item.description: Building large-scale distributed systems is a challenge in any language: what about Go makes distributed system-building easier, what makes it harder, and what won't work at all? Former Google software engineer Ben Sigelman answers these questions in his talk about creating distributed systems in Go.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building Web Services in Go
item.description: This talk is about Building Web Services in Go by Richard Crowley from Betable.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: A Tour of Cryptography Package in Go
item.description: A system needs confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity to be secure. Kyle Isom (Software Engineer, Cloudflare) gives us a full tour of cryptography packages in Go with examples with hashing, random data, HMAC, and NaCl.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Finding Memory Leaks in Go

item.title: Video: Integrating Django with Wordpress can be simple

item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Hijacking Hacker News with Ember.js
item.description: In this session, we will look at several unconventional things you can do with Ember.js and Ember Data. We will be breathing new life into the Hacker News website via a chrome extension.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Design for Ember Apps
item.description: Ember allows us to design highly adaptive, extendable, and fast web apps, but with those possibilities comes greater responsibility. In this talk Ill hone in on those requirements with relevant examples and give the audience a starting point to make their next Ember.js product design successful.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Ember.js Performance
item.description: One overarching theme in the Ember.js philosophy is to put developers on a path to success, primarily this is done by making that path have the lowest resistance. On several fronts this pattern has been quite successful, but on one important front we fall short, performance. This is the result of framework and run-time misalignment. This talk describes how we as a community can solve this problem in our apps and the framework.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Real World Django Q&A
item.description: Have questions about getting better performance out of Django or scaling it up large? We've assembled a group of knowledgable Django experts who have been there to answer the questions you have. While every site has its own challenges most follow similar patterns that are often easy to solve.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Interaction Design with Ember 2.0 and Polymer
item.description: This talk will show you how to leverage the power of Ember 2.0 and Polymer to create remarkable user experiences.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building Real-time applications with Ember
item.description: In this session, we'll investigate a few strategies for integrating browser features like WebSockets as well as third-party libraries into our ember-cli applications. We'll look at how to structure an application using standalone controllers, initializer objects, and services.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Aligning Ember with Web Standards
item.description: Ember, to help us build apps today, has provided its own version of many ES6 and ES7 features. As the drafts become specs and browsers add new capabilities, the framework will need to reconfigure itself around them.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Ember.js Test-Driven Development
item.description: Join me for an intense 25 minute live coding session where I build an ember application from the ground up test-first with nothing but the terminal and my favorite text editor! I'll share some of the tribal knowledge about what makes a great unit or functional test and how you decide to write one over the other.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Dynamic Graphic Composition in Ember.js
item.description: Ember's declarative object model and data-binding make it an excellent fit for building data visualizations that respond to change. This talk presents two ways to think about building dynamic SVG visualizations in Ember in the context of Hadley Wickham's The Grammar of Graphics.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Ember Observer
item.description: This talk will show you how to work with Ember Observer.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The Art of Ember Deployment

item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Geo+Django: Geo beyond the Django
item.description: Learn about GeoDjango and Geographic Information Systems and navigate beyond the docs into the exciting GIS technology landscape.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Digging into Django's Migrations

item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Performant Django

item.title: Video: Go at CoreOS

It had been almost 10 years since a new Linux distro was created. With the entrance of the cloud era, moving deeply into distributed computing based on Linux containers and multi-core machines, we needed a language that would allow our developers to iterate rapidly and create self-contained.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Drawing Paths - Lines and Rectangles

item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Data Basics
item.description: Core Data is Apple's framework for persisting data on Mac & iOS. It can be though of as an ORM, however it's probably a lot different than most ORMs you've used in the past.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Importing into Core Data
item.description: In this screencast I'll pull down data from an API, map the JSON to a Core Data Managed Object and import them in bulk on a background thread.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Automatic Reference Counting
item.description: In this episode, I'll show you how to convert your project to use Automatic Reference Counting (or ARC) to eliminate the need to use retain, release, autorelease, and dealloc in your Objective-C code!
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Xcode 5 Autolayout Improvements
item.description: This week we have another free bonus video on the improvements that Xcode 5 brings to Autolayout. As something that has been quite obnoxious to work with in the past, many people dismissed auto layout when it was introduced to iOS 6.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Hello, iOS 7
item.description: To celebrate the launch of iOS 7, here is a bonus free screencast covering a few of the concepts in iOS 7 such as the status bar behavior, tint color, and navigation bar transitions.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Where we start?
item.description: This is videos has some tips for everybody starts develop into an Android environment.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Activities
item.description: Just a little introduction about Activities.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Layouts
item.description: Another Android's introduction video, but now it's about Layout.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Application Object
item.description: In this Android tutorial, Marko will show you how to create your own implementation of the Application object, which you can use to make common features accessible to most parts of your Android app.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: AsyncTask, Preferences and Options menu
item.description: In this tutorial Marko will begin with an explanation of threading in Android, and how you can use AsyncTask to enable proper use of the UI thread. Marko will also cover how the Android file system is organized as well as how you can use intents and the options menu to jump from one activity to another.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Main Building Blocks
item.description: In this 70-minute tutorial Marko Gargenta will demonstate the main building blocks for Android application development by showing you the processes behind a real world Android app.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Android UI
item.description: In this 2-hour tutorial Marko will build an Android app from scratch in-order to illustrate some of the key concepts for Android UI development. By the end of this tutorial you should have a solid foundation for beginning to work with the Android UI, as well as some best practices for UI development.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Spicing up the UI
item.description: In this 50-minute tutorial, Marko will pick up where he left off with in the last session, and show you how to spice up the Android UI by adding graphics, themes and colors.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Drawables
item.description: This 60-minute tutorial will focus on Android drawables and how you can use styles and the draw9patch tool to ensure they look great and scale properly across devices.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Traceview
item.description: In this 40-minute tutorial, Marko will show you how you can use the Android SDK tool Traceview to analyze data and debug issues in your Android application.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Effective Android Messaging
item.description: Messaging is a powerful addition to your Android app, but implementation can be tricky. Juan Gomez gives an overview on how to use the messaging protocols currently available on the Android platform.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Bluetooth & USB for Android
item.description: The Android framework provides options for connecting external accessory devices to applications via technologies like Bluetooth and USB. Learn how to expand the reach of your Android devices.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Exploring SDK add-ons for Android Devices
item.description: Larry Schiefer, instructor here at NewCircle, discusses the Android SDK, in this technical class from AnDevCon '13.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Mastering the Android Touch System
item.description: Dave Smith outlines the Android touch system, and then dives into the code, in this talk from AnDevCon '13.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Getting Started
item.description: This lesson will help get you started with Android development. Well begin, as expected, with the obligatory 'hello world' example.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: UI Designer
item.description: Lets begin by discussing the key aspects of designing user interface applications in Android.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is Meteor?
item.description: I'll illustrate the key components on the client (browser) and the server that make Meteor a full-stack framework. This video will provide you a mental map for learning Meteor in depth.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building an Meteor Application
item.description: In this video I'll introduce the Building an Application with Meteor and Iron Router class.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Iron Router Introduction
item.description: This video introduces the Inside Iron Router class. Get a preview of what's to come in the rest of the class.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is Rectivity?
item.description: In this introduction we'll explore what it means to be reactive and we'll see where Meteor implements this functionality.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction the Livedata Class
item.description: The livedata package is where we get Meteor methods, publish and subscribe, DDP client and server. In this class we'll start off by looking at how traditional Web applications use the HTTP protocol.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introducing The Shark Preview Track
item.description: The Meteor Shark Preview Track starts with the new Spacebars templating system and how it differs from the previous system. Then we'll look at how to create and use components. And of course, we'll dive into the internals of Spacebars and Components.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Make a Reactive Join in the UI
item.description: How do you reactively join two collections in the user interface? In this video we'll explore two ways to join documents in the user interface. The first prevents reactivity. The second enables reactivity.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Publish a Many-to-Many Relationship
item.description: Although we're using document oriented storage with MongoDB, sometimes it's useful to normalize our data in separate collections. In this episode, I'll show you how to publish a many-to-many relationship from a single publish function.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Publish to a Client Only Collection
item.description: In this episode we'll publish automatically refreshing, signed CloudFront urls to a client only Collection. We'll use Iron Router for routing and subscribing to a publish function depending on which page we're on.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Reactive Properties
item.description: JavaScript allows us to configure object properties. We can use this idea to create reactive properties in Meteor. In this video I'll show you how to create a reactive property method and turn it into a local package.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Waiting on Subscriptions
item.description: What does it mean to 'wait' on a subscription to be ready? In this video we'll explore the DDP 'ready' message and two ways of waiting on subscription data to be ready.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Java 8: Lambdas and new APIs
item.description: This talk will show you some new concepts about Lambdas, Streams, Collectors and Java.time from Java 8.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Java 8's JVM
item.description: In this talk you will learn what has changed in JVM from Java 8.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction OOP
item.description: Let's learn the OOP (Object Oriented Programming) basic using Java.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Object Introduction
item.description: In this episode you will learn the basics about Java objects.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Class
item.description: In this video let's learn about how to build classes.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Class attributes
item.description: A short video about attribute classes for beginners.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Functions and Methods
item.description: A good video about how to handle with functions and methods.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Parameters and arguments
item.description: This is the second video about functions and methods, now explaining what are parameters and arguments.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Instances
item.description: In this video you will learn how to initialize a class creating an object's instance.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Overloading methods
item.description: A good video which explains how to overloading methods.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Instances
item.description: In this video you will learn how to initialize a class creating an object's instance.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Beginning with Vim
item.description: This is a long screencast for beginners and intermediates learn about Vim.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Show invisibles
item.description: In this episode, I demonstrate how to customise the appearance of these characters by tweaking the listchars setting. I go on to show how to make these invisible characters blend in with your colortheme.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tabs and spaces
item.description: This episode explains the purpose of tabstop, softtabstop, shiftwidth and expandtab settings, and illustrates how Vim behaves using various combinations of these.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Whitespace preferences and filetypes
item.description: Different file types may require particular whitespace settings. These preferences can be specified by hooking into the FileType event with an autocommand.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tidying whitespaces
item.description: This episode demonstrates a few techniques for tidying up whitespace. First, it looks at how to convert between tabs and spaces. Then it shows how to strip trailing whitespace, and finally, how to remove blank lines from a file.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Indentation commands
item.description: This episode covers the commands for shifting text left and right (< and >), and also goes over the auto indent command (=).
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Working with buffers
item.description: Introducing the buffer list, and commands for switching between buffers. This episode also covers the concept of hidden buffers, and shows how to deal with them.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Working with windows
item.description: This episode demonstrates all the essentials of working with windows: opening, closing, resizing, moving between and rearranging them.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Working with tabs
item.description: This episode covers the essential commands for working with Vims tab pages: opening and closing, switching, and moving them.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Meet UltiSnips
item.description: Snippets allow you to quickly insert predefined chunks of text into your document. The feature as I know it was first introduced in TextMate, but it has since been emulated by many other editors. For Vim users who want this functionality, the UltiSnips plugin is a great choice. Lets start by looking at the basics.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Operating on search matches using gn
item.description: The gn command (introduced in Vim 7.4) makes it easy to operate on regions of text that match the current search pattern. Its especially useful when used with a regex that matches text regions of variable length.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using Vim's paste mode with the system paste command
item.description: When Vim is compiled without the +clipboard feature, we can still insert text from the clipboard using the system paste command (ctrl-v or cmd-v). This can produce strange effects, but we can avoid them by toggling the paste option each time we use the system paste command.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Search multiple files with :vimgrep
item.description: vimgrep is Vims built-in command for searching across multiple files. Its not so fast as external tools like ack and git-grep, but it has its uses. vimgrep uses Vims built-in regex engine, so you can reuse the patterns that work with Vims standard search command.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Profiling Vimscript performance
item.description: Vim users are unforgiving of plugins that impair performance. Luckily, Vim provides built-in profiling tools that make it easy to diagnose performance issues. Well start by looking at how to profile the vimrc file, then move on to a real world scenario where profiling helped to identify and aleviate a performance bottleneck.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction of Chrome DevTools
item.description: Welcome to this course on Chrome Developer Tools. To start out, well take a brief look through each panel in the DevTools. Many cutting-edge features well be covering can be found in Chrome Canary which contains the latest and greatest.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Secrets of DevTools - Elements
item.description: In this episode, let's learn about how to manipulate elements using Google Chrome DevTools.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Secrets of DevTools - Style
item.description: In this episode, you will learn about customize stylesheets.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Secrets of DevTools - Workspaces
item.description: In this episode, you will understand what is a workspaces and your benefits.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Secrets of DevTools - Console
item.description: In this episode, let's use the javascript console, to help you develop faster your apps.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Secrets of DevTools - Debug
item.description: In this episode, you will learn how to debug javascript files.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is Version Control?
item.description: How does version control work in general? What benefits can I expect?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Installing & Configuring Git
item.description: How do I install and configure Git on my machine?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The Basic Workflow of Version Control
item.description: Which steps are typically involved when using version control?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Creating a New Local Repository
item.description: How do I create a new repository on my machine?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Cloning an Existing Repository
item.description: How can I work with an existing repository from a remote server?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Inspecting Local Changes
item.description: Which files are currently modified - and how?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Staging & Committing Changes
item.description: How can I add changes to the next commit? How can I save changes as a new revision in the repository?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Commit History
item.description: How can I see what has happened in my repository? How can I review my repository's history?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Ignoring Files
item.description: How can I prevent certain files from being versioned / tracked by Git?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to Branches
item.description: What are branches? What is so special about the branching model (compared to SVN)? Why should you use them?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Creating & Checking Out Branches
item.description: How can I create a branch? How can I make a branch active?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is Version Control?
item.description: This video explains the basics of a version control.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What is Git?
item.description: In this video you will learn an introduction about Git.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Get Going with Git
item.description: In this episode the main commands will be explained about how to survive using Git.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Quick wins with Git
item.description: This video explains some useful tips for Git.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Beginning with Git
item.description: This is a long screencast for beginners and intermediates learn about Git.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Famo.us
item.description: In this episode, Dave Fetterman explains what Famo.us is and how it can be used to build beautiful and performant applications with their framework.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Meteor + Famo.us: Made for each other
item.description: An introduction video which explores how to integrate Famo.us with Meteor frameworks
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to Play Framework for Scala developers
item.description: Play Framework makes it easy to build scalable, fast and real-time web applications with Java & Scala.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to Play Framework for Java developers
item.description: Play Framework makes it easy to build scalable, fast and real-time web applications with Java & Scala.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Play All Day: Enterprise Web Development with Play and Scala
item.description: In this session you will learn architecture strategies to help develop Play and Scala applications on large enterprise projects.The talk will cover strategies to help integrate Play with complex ecosystems and other enterprise development challenges.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Play All Day: Reactive Streams and Play 3.0
item.description: This presentation will dive deep into Play's architecture, and show just how reactive streams will be applied to and improve Play.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Play All Day: Playing with Akka
item.description: In this talk you will learn about how the Huffington Post leverages Akka inside of Play to build highly concurrent, low latency and fault tolerant applications to deal with process workflow and asynchronous integrations to various backend data sources.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Optimizing Play for Production
item.description: Play Framework is easy to deploy and scale but like any system some optimizations can help things run more smoothly. This webinar will teach you the basics of deployment, configuring thread pools, managing blocking, and common performance pitfalls.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Redoing Make
item.description: Let's build an implementation of djb's redo from scratch in Haskell. In this, the first episode, I'll explain what the purpose of the program is, write some initial code, and create a GitHub repository for you to follow along with if you want.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: GHCi's Debugger
item.description: Interactive debugging is possible in Haskell with GHCi. We'll look at how, and use it to fix what broke last episode. Then, we'll extend the implementation to support target selection on the commandline.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Hoogle in GHCi
item.description: Run Hoogle from GHCi and save yourself some time switching over to a browser. Or just take a look at how to customize your GHCi with me.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Unsafe Functions
item.description: The Prelude contains an innocent-looking but unsafe function. We'll encounter it as we add support for default .do files. The implementation of defaults will be guided by a paper from Alan Grosskurth who himself created a redo implementation (in shell script).
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Refactoring Monads
item.description: Monad do notation is convenient but can also get in the way of writing concise code. We'll refactor the code until it's shorter, (arguably) more readable, and less error-prone to make changes to. In the process we'll also add the feature we were missing to get default .do files working.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tracing and Showing
item.description: 'Printf-style debugging' is possible with Haskell thanks to Debug.Trace, as long as the value you're interested in has a Show instance. Using tracing, we'll start to explore a method of collecting dependency/prerequisite information from .do scripts through the use of a redo-ifchange program.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Exception Handling
item.description: Exceptions are a pain in any language, but they have some unique quirks in Haskell. We'll look at how to catch certain types of exceptions, figure out the type of exception you've ended up with, and how to handle it.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Laziness and ...
item.description: Laziness (non-strictness) can have confusing effects, especially with a fake pure function like trace. And on the topic of laziness, we'll encounter lazy ByteStrings for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: HLint and Flymake
item.description: HLint helps keep your code clean. With Flymake and GHC you can keep it clean in realtime. Join me as I finally modernize my development environment so that I can see errors and warnings as I type.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Recursion and Redis
item.description: It's time to test our implementation or redo by converting an existing make-based build system over to it. I've picked redis as our target due to its relatively simple Makefile and its avoidance of automake.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Replacing Make
item.description: Goodbye, Make! It's time to see where the design of redo really shines by replacing the Makefiles in redis with .do scripts. We'll adapt a style that djb adopts for his own projects when writing build scripts.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Cabal and Hackage
item.description: It's time to release our code to (upon?) the world. The Haskell community is still small and trusting, and getting your code on Hackage (hence making it cabal installable) is pretty simple. We'll generate a .cabal file for redo and then use that to package our code for Hackage.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Documentation and Haddock
item.description: I'm embarrassed by how long I've let this program go without a single comment, let alone some proper documentation. We'll add documentation in 3 layers: external (README.markdown), top-level (Haddock), and narrative (comments).
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Porting to Windows
item.description: Running redo on Windows seems counterintuitive first considering that redo is built around many Unix philosophies. But as it turns out, it's possible. We'll make some changes to the Cabal install process and then add some conditional installation instructions for Windows.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using wait, waitOn and ready in Routes
item.description: Confused about how to use waitOn, wait and the reactive ready method in your routes? In this video I'll show you how these work using the reactive WaitList.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Synchronizing Method Writes
item.description: Meteor synchronizes writes that happen on the client with the result we ultimately get back from the server. In this video you'll get some intuition about what this means. Then in the rest of the class we'll dive into the mechanics of how it works.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Updating Meteor and Package Versions
item.description: In this video we'll update a project to use Meteor 0.8.0 and iron-router 0.7.0.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The UI.Each Component
item.description: The each block helper renders a UI.Each Component. In this video we'll explore the UI.Each component's implementation and its new features and benefits.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Make a Reactive Join in the UI
item.description: How do you reactively join two collections in the user interface? In this video we'll explore two ways to join documents in the user interface. The first prevents reactivity. The second enables reactivity.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building Realtime Apps With Firebase and Angular
item.description: In this talk you'll learn about how to use Firebase and Angular together and learn why building a modern realtime app will never be the same again.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using AngularJS to create iPhone & Android applications with PhoneGap
item.description: This talk will we cover Setup of a PhoneGap (Apache Cordova) project using the AngularJS framework using npm, bower, grunt & cordova. Directory structure for a sample AngularJS application Compilation to iOS with Xcode & Android with Eclipse ADT.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Angular with Browserify
item.description: This session will introduce Browserify and the CommonJS module format, discuss the benefits they provide, and demonstrate how to utilize those benefits in the context of an Angular app.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Icons -- Polycasts #01
item.description: This post is part 1 of my many-part series entitled Python for .NET Developers. This first video and blog post simply introduce the series and provide a very brief Python language introduction. Without further adieu, heres the video.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Iconset -- Polycasts #02
item.description: Creating your own icon set in Polymer is a breeze! In this video we'll look at how to combine different iconsets with the core-icon elements, and I'll show you how to create your own custom iconsets using SVG images.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Toolbar -- Polycasts #03
item.description: The core-toolbar element is a great place to start with Web Components because it's very easy to get up and running. With the core-toolbar you can layout titles, buttons, and various other controls for your application. In this video we'll cover getting your first core-toolbar up on screen, and configuring it with a handful of useful options.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Header Panel -- Polycasts #04
item.description: The core-header-panel is a great next step after you've mastered some of the other elements like core-icon and core-toolbar. With core-header-panel we can control the scroll behavior of our page and combine it with other elements, like core-toolbar, to compose app-like UIs. In this video we'll not only get a core-header-panel to show up.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Core Drawer Panel -- Polycasts #05
item.description: A big part of building for the multi-device web is responsive design. To make this easy on us, the Polymer team created the core-drawer-panel element, an application scaffold that's responsive by default! In this video I'll show you how to setup a page layout that leverages the core-drawer-panel, and we'll also look at drawer panel's fancier older brother, the core-scaffold.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: What's new in Polymer 0.5.1 -- Polycasts #06
item.description: In today's video we take a look at the current stable release of Polymer, v0.5.1, and cover some of the changes that this update brings with it.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Season's greetings! -- Polycasts #07
item.description: Hey there Polycasters! We wanted to take a moment to wish you all very happy holidays and thank you so much for checking out the first season. In today's episode we have highlights from the Chrome Dev Summit and a survey so *you* can let us know what content you'd like to see in the second season.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The Awesome Power of Auto-Binding Templates -- Polycasts #08
item.description: Super charge your app with Polymer data bindings.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Polymer 101 Part 1: Hello World
item.description: Utilizing the polymer-element component to create new components

item.title: Video: Robotics powering interfaces with AngularJS to the Arduino
item.description: In this talk, we'll discuss the power of the arduino to interface software with the rest of our human experience. We'll discuss the real-time nature of the arduino and how we can surface the sensor data through a real-time interface.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Angular Performance
item.description: In this talk, you'll learn some tips to build an optimized angular app, exploring best practices and diagnosing performance problems.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building an Angular App: Introduction
item.description: In this lesson, we introduce our sample AngularJS application and discuss our objectives for this series.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building an Angular App: Bootstrapping
item.description: In this lesson, we learn how to take a static HTML page and tap into the power of AngularJS by bootstrapping the framework.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building an Angular App: Filters
item.description: We are going to learn how to filter our bookmarks based on the selected category. We will learn how to manage the current category in the controller as well as set the current category from the view.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building an Angular App: Controllers
item.description: We are going to take the static HTML elements and dynamically display them on the page by setting up an AngularJS controller and hooking it up with AngularJS templating in the view.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Directive Definition Object (DDO)
item.description: Directive Definition Objects are used to configure AngularJS directives.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: $apply vs $digest
item.description: $apply and $digest are both methods on AngularJS scopes that allow you to manually trigger the updates to bound properties on your scopes.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using ngModel in Custom Directives
item.description: You can use ngModel in your own directives, but there are a few things you'll need to do to get it working properly.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Protractor Interactive
item.description: Did you know that Protractor has a handy interactive mode to help with writing/debugging your end-to-end (e2e) tests?
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to Grunt for Angular
item.description: Task automation is critical for any AngularJS single-page application. Grunt gets the job done.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using $resource for Data Models
item.description: In this video, Brett will show you the basics of using $resource, as well as talking about some of the drawbacks with using this service for your data models.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Model Validation Design Review
item.description: We want robust validation for our AngularJS models. This will require a bit of forethought, and this lesson will examine the goals that we have for the validation piece of our model library.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Custom Django Admin Actions
item.description: Doing bulk data actions in the admin is easy, if you know how to do it. In this video you will learn how to create your own custom admin actions so you can update a lot of data objects all at the same time.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Project Templates with Cookiecutter
item.description: When we start new projects we want to solve a problem, not write boilerplate. Cookiecutter helps you to stop writing boilerplate. In this video you will learn what cookiecutter is, and how to create templates so you can save yourself time and effort starting new projects.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Using Arrow for Better Datetime
item.description: Learn how to be better at dealing with dates and times in python in a few short minutes. Working with dates and times in python is a lot easier than other languages, but can be convoluted and confusing. Arrow provides a convenient api for working with and manipulating dates and times. See what it takes to get started.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: The Class Based 'View'
item.description: People often find working with class based views hard, but they are simple... Once you spend time figuring them out. In this video start with the base of building blocks and work your way through completly understanding the base View of (generic) class based views.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Understanding get_absolute_url
item.description: URL's can be a pain at times, but with get_absolute_url on your model it can make dealing with them on a per-object basis much simpler and cleaner across your entire site. Not to mention Django itself loves to use get_absolute_url, so it will make other tasks a lot easier.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Starting with django-allauth
item.description: There are a lot of ways to do authentication in django. You can do social authentication and/or django.contrib.auth authentication. Generally they are separate, but with django-allauth you can combine them both into one package. It even gives you a great jumping off place with plenty of other features.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Stripe, Webhooks and dj-stripe
item.description: Stripe is great for working with payments. Webhooks and dj-stripe make it even better, in this video learn how to use stripe webhooks with your application to get the most out of your stripe integration.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Stripe and Starting dj-stripe
item.description: Stripe is great, but using a library makes it even better. Dj-stripe is a great django library for working with stripe to get people to subscribe to your service. See how simple it is to start working with dj-stripe.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Starting with Stripe.js
item.description: We all want to make money, so learn what it takes to start accepting money on your site with stripe. Learn the basics of have a user subscribe to your site in this first part of a multi-part stripe series.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Django 1.7 Migrations - An Introduction
item.description: See what it takes to use the new migrations system that has been integrated into Django 1.7. This video walks you through how to create migrations, and run them. Along with a few other key points you might want to know.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Better Models Through Custom Managers and QuerySets
item.description: Learn what it takes to get common queries chain-able, and slimmer. This video goes over custom model managers and custom querysets so you can write better code, cleaner, code by harnessing the power of Django and OOP.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Compile and Compress Assets with django-pipeline
item.description: Using things like CoffeeScript, Stylus, Less, SASS/SCSS, etc... Is becoming a more and more core part of development, but the problem usually is compiling these assets for use on our site. With django-pipeline this process is now much easier in both development and production.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: django-storages and AmazonS3
item.description: Saving files in the cloud, be it Amazon S3, Azure, or Rackspace, is very common now and almost a requirement. django-storages makes this seemless. This video shows you just how easy it is to get started.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Start Your API - django-rest-framework part 1
item.description: In this video we start creating our API by learning what it takes to put data in our database, and retrieve it back doing all of our CRUD operations. django-rest-framework makes it very simple to accomplish with a minimal amount of effort.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Permissions & Authentication - django-rest-framework part 2
item.description: Learn how to use basic authentication with your new API, and setup custom permissions to get fine grained precision of what can be done with data.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Django Testing 1
item.description: In this week's screencast we will discussing setting up testing using django and pytest-django. We introduce the django project we will be using for testing courtside. We cover use of django-fixtures and testing django views with py.test.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Django Testing 2
item.description: In this week's screencast we take the test we wrote last week and we integrate factory_boy. This tool allows you to create sample data for your web application quickly and easily, while reducing the complexity of maintaining django fixtures as well as speeds up your test speed.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Django Custom Template Tags
item.description: In this week's screencast we introduce custom template tag in our courtside application. We will learn how to implement, use, and include custom template tags in our projects.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Tunning the browser with AngularJS
item.description: A hangouts about AngularJS.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Hands-on Angular Front-end Setup
item.description: In this lesson, we'll set up the Angular front-end application with the help of Yeoman. We'll learn the structure of the application and the cool things Yeoman provides out of the box like testing and LiveReload.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Building Distributed Systems with Node.js and MQ

item.title: Video: Thinking in React

item.title: Video: Hello World - First Component
item.description: This is the first lesson in a series of lessons that take a look at the core fundamentals of UI development with React. Hello world.

item.title: Video: The Render Method

item.description: This lesson will teach you the basics of setting properties in your React components.

item.description: CommonJS modules provide a clean way to import dependencies in JavaScript.

item.description: I will show you how to create and interact with Generators, and your life will be better! (I might be overselling it)

item.description: This talk will share some concepts about how create nodebots.

item.description: This is a speaker from Hunter Loftis which introduces a node architecture applications case for production environment.

item.description: This talk is from Shubhra Kar and will share some tips and tools about how built REST APIs with Node.js

item.description: Lodash is a toolkit of Javascript functions that provides clean, performant methods for manipulating objects and collections. It is a 'fork' of the Underscore library and provides additional functionality as well as some serious performance improvements. If you aren't using Lodash, you should be.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: ECMAscript 6 Arrow function
item.description: ECMAscript 6 introduces the 'arrow function' as a shortcut for creating anonymous functions with this scope bound.

item.title: Video: ECMAscript 6 Array comprehensions
item.description: With ECMAscript 6 you have access to powerful array comprehensions for generating new arrays from existing arrays based on criteria you specify.

item.description: Generators in ECMAscript 6 are first-class coroutines that produce encapsulated suspended execution contexts. Whew! Yield values and iterate over them until no more values exist in the generator. We'll talk more about practical use later.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Introduction to ECMAScript 6
item.description: Welcome to What's Coming to JavaScript. ECMAScript 6 introduces many new features to the language. We won't look at all of them, but we will spend time with the big new features that will fundamentally change the way we write JavaScript.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: Picking the ECMAScript 6 environment
item.description: Because ES6 is not finalized, we will not find an environment that implements 100% of the specification. There are two environments we'll use: Google Traceur and Firefox Nightly
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.description: In this episode, youll see: UMDJS, Project Dependencies with NPM, Grunt-Rigger and AMD Build.

item.description: In this episode I will show you the basics of how to install and use the standalone version of the Jasmine testing framework, to write unit tests for your JavaScript applications.

We don't build a framework, per se; we just show a way of organizing our app so that everything has a place, and we know where to find what we're looking for.
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Video: NVM: Node Package Manager
item.description: In this episode, I'm going to show you how I installed Node and a fantastic tool for managing different Node versions. Node is under active development, so new versions come out pretty regularly. With today's episode, you'll be able to experiment with the new ones with ease.

item.title: Video: Authorization with Passport - Part 1

And that's a good stepping stone, but it's not quite enough for an effective application. We need to prevent access to entire sections of our application based on whether or not the user is logged in.

item.title: Video: Authorization with Passport - Part 2
item.description: In our previous episodes with Passport we've set up a way to verify that a user is who the user claims to be. In this episode we're going to ensure that our users have the permissions they're claiming, and we do that with a package called 'authorized'.

item.description: Mocha is a testing framework that provides us with a way to organize tests and group them together logically. Paired up with the `assert` module that's built right into Node, Mocha quite nearly takes care of all the framework we need to write tests. We won't get into testing our route handlers here, but this episode will give us the core that we need to start testing our domain layer.

item.description: We're going to round out or Jade knowledge with a look at its more advanced features. Have a list of things you need to iterate over? We've got you covered.
